reviews.review_msg: Great prof, loved listening to the lectures. The amount of information in each slide was a little overwhelming but very thourough and informative, especially if you don't want to read the textbook. IMO researching and writing the term paper was super fun, and if you follow the criteria you'll get a great mark. My TA, Mira Dhaliwal was also amazing!

slides are pretty much the textbook in a condensed form--HOWEVER.. if you care to get A's on your exams, you should also read and study the textbook since she puts some information from the text on the exams. her multiple choice options are very difficult in the sense that you dont know if its A or C because both can be argued for

Suzanna was fantastic. Her grading criteria is very clear and she really sets every student up for success. She even offers activities to boost up your grade by 3%, which is helpful if you're between grades. Her lectures are heavy, but the content is interesting and she's very engaging. Exams are super fair and not hard if you prepare.

The lectures and topics themselves were super interesting. Dr. Michner herself was pretty chill and willing to give extensions to any assignments. She went through the material pretty fast but thorough. The lectures were recorded and the slides were posted which was super helpful. The written portions were large components of the exams.

Overall, she is a great prof. However, for a first-year university student, her grading can get overwhelming. Be prepared to write notes nonstop for her class from start to finish. Her test questions were pretty complicated compared to what she told what's mainly on it. However, she was great for allowing extensions at the last minute.

Suzanna is amazing! She is very kind, allows extensions if needed and easy to connect with via email. Her exams are basically entirely based on the lecture, so it's easy to do well if you attend or review them. 103 is content heavy and can be a difficult first year course, but she makes it easy. The term paper was short and had clear guidelines.

She was very nice and caring, and the course content was interesting but the final paper deadline wasn't quite fair. On the day it was due, she openly let people request an extension if they weren't done yet, which isn't fair to the people who met the deadline.

She's really sweet and has such a good energy. Very accommodating, gives extensions. Lectures are content heavy and the exams are tough, but it's a comprehensive intro class. I didn't get the textbook and I did just fine. Study hard and you'll be alright. She provides very clear expectations for the exams and paper. I would highly recommend!

She is really understanding and provides a chance to boost your grade by 3%. If you need an extension,  don't hesitate to ask her as she is very lenient. Reading your textbook is very important for this class if you want to be able to understand what the lecture is discussing. She provides detail information about midterm and final.

I found tests were graded quite hard and there was a LOT of content. I spent the most time out of all my classes studying for this course's exam. She is very understanding and lenient with extensions and offers a 3% boost in final grade. Very sweet and kind but lectures were very content heavy. Not the easiest class for GPA booster.

Suzanna was a great prof. I know I rated her as a difficult prof but she was... a good one tho. For this course lectures had core case info that is not provided on the slides and are needed in tests. 4 Open-book quizzes but timed (Do MC last to have time). No final/midterm. 5 writing assignments marked hard by TA's. 10% Participation in tutorial.

very cool class with a solid prof. I try to avoid lectures at all costs, but her lectures are pretty interesting. tutorials also pretty cool. Exams are pretty tough, not my best grade in a class but it was still prob my fav class at sfu in my crim major.

Dr. Michener was caring and understanding offering up to 3% extra credit. However, I do believe for a first year course, the paper and exams were graded much too harshly and the written exam questions as well. Her lectures were very content heavy and anything may appear on the exam as well

Suzanna cares about her students and it shows. She is lenient within reason, and she is also passionate about the things she teaches. However, she is not that great of a lecturer, though she makes up for it by being so understanding.
Great teacher who makes sure every student is ready for their exams. Exams are by the lecture.
SO MUCH WORK and the grading was all over the place! Very interesting subject but there were so many assignments and Suzanna gave very mixed instructions.

Overall Suzana was nice and cared to help you understand. However, the TAs were awful. Very inconsistent grading with no feedback at all. At the end of the semester, we have no idea where we stand, it takes them 2 months to finish grading each assignment. In the biweekly one-hour quizzes usually there was not even time to answer all questions.

Honestly was not impressed with this course. Suzanna was understanding and cared, but the grading in this class was horrible. The TAs graded on and off on EVERYONE's work, so we did not have a designated TA, and there was a lot of inconsistency with grading. NO HELPFUL FEEDBACK was provided after assignments were returned.

i think the prof is genuinely nice and cares, the main issue was the TAs graded so differently and quite harsh especially compared to the prof. the class is extremely heavy in readings, assignments but instead of exams its biweekly quizzes which were generally fair but sometimes challenging

I think Suzanna it pretty chill and the material was good; no midterm or final or paper; just 6 open-book quizzes, 6 paragraph questions, and making your own test questions. HOWEVER, the TA's were insufferable and the criteria were super vague. You barely get feedback and your grade depends on who marked your assignments. Overall an OK class

Dr. Michener has a clear course layout. Her lectures are quite full, so be sure to read the textbook chapter beforehand to keep up with the lecture content (lectures are recorded). The TSSU strike did complicate dates, but she adjusted relatively well. The final term paper was fine, just be sure to research well and don't leave it until the end.

Suzanna is very passionate about her class, lectures were fast-paced (due to strike catchup) but clear. Lots of reading but it's possible to get away without doing any if you stay focused in lectures and take good notes.

Good prof. Lectures are interesting and all the topics this course covers are interesting. Weekly assignments so make sure you plan time well. If midterm and final exam were in person then this class would be much harder, but she made it online for us. LOTS and LOTS of reading though. Labs are fun too.

Suzanna's lectures were super entertaining, she tried her best after the strike to make sure students didn't struggle by allocating our marks. There is a lot of reading from the textbook, but the exam mostly covered lecture materials so you should be fine.

Our class was severely impacted by the strike but Suzanna helped us re-allocate our midterm marks by quizzes each week of November. Although there is a lot to do and you must stay on top of your work, this class was very manageable and super interesting. She is cute and funny and makes little jokes here and there. Lectures were recorded

Great professor, she wants her students to succeed and do well in her class. I would highly recommend taking this course with her. She is very easygoing and makes your semester and life easier. She prepares many activities for tutorials which are very helpful to study. She consider's students opinions in everything which most profs don't do at SFU

Great teacher, interesting lectures. Labs are fun and marked for participation. Monthly assignments, a mid term and final and participation was the overall grades. Not an easy class but definitely interesting.

This course was extremely interesting however the strike made it quite difficult. The material was dense however still interesting but try your best to keep up with everything if you want to do well. Labs were interesting and mandatory.

Class was heavy with reading each week. About 50-80 pages per week.  Each lecture was jam packed with information, and as my class was effected by the strike, they became even more fast paced.  The information is very interesting, but the professor didn't have much compassion that our class was rushed due to the strike.

This course is interesting and the topics are fun to learn. I would recommend skimming through the TB before each lecture, since the slides are very long and packed with information. The paper is real easy if you do enough research on it, if you don't then it's gonna be hard to meet the word count requirement.
There is so much info on the slides and it will all show up on the midterm and final. This class had a presentation, paper, midterm, and final making it a super time consuming course

Her lectures were long but informative, so reading the TB prior is a good idea to not get as overwhelmed. The midterm was online and long, but the final was more reasonable in length for the time given. We had an 8-page final paper that was marked fairly tough for a first-year course, in my opinion. The course content was overall interesting.

Dr. Michener is a talented teacher of all things. I'm convinced she could teach me anything. Lecture heavy, but they're so interesting. Read the textbook prior to class and it will keep you more engaged in lecture as it minimizes the chances you'll be overwhelmed by content. She always seemed extremely understanding.

I took CRIM 355 online and was not the biggest fan. No lecture recordings/slides, just paragraphs under headings. Discussion posts were due every week but it was pretty easy to get full marks if you put a bit of effort in them. The final exam was a lot more cumulative than I was expecting though, and I wish that was clarified further beforehand.
Two words: GPA Killer

SO much information is packed into her lectures, adding new information to what the textbook says. No break during her lecture, but they're recorded. Exams were long, and the time to finish the midterm was too short with lots of people not finishing. Presentation and paper were easy. She's a cool person, but her teaching style is not for everyone.
This class was brutal, and the exams were time crunch. There was no lecture recordings at all, but there was tons of readings. Overall, very unpleasant and would not recommend this prof.

Midterm is online, but it was pretty long, had to leave some questions blank cuz of the time limit. Final exam, 90 MC questions + 10 short answer questions, but you get 3 hours to do it. Overall, tests were pretty heavy, make sure to study the material

Pretty heavy lectures, she reads off of her notes and speaks pretty fast, so hard to take notes. There's a presentation with 10% which was pretty easy (depending on the TA). The paper was pretty short (2200 words max, but overall, I would not take this class again. Also, no breaks during her lectures...so just read the textbook.

This class was heavy. Use the textbook and go to the lecture. The lectures are boring overloaded with 50 slides at least and are so fast it is hard to take notes. Her midterm was too long to finish and many people left questions blank due to the short amount of time. The final paper and presentation aren't too bad but the paper is long. Not good.

Suzanna is wonderful! Clear grading criteria, helpful power points, and interesting content that made all the reading bearable! Weekly assignments, midterm, final exam + final paper (8 pages)! CRIM103 is definitely one of my favourite courses.
Marks at their own whim, not a pleasant experience as a student.

Suzanna is great and super chill. This class was in person but she recorded and posted every lecture. She kinda just reads off her notes but the content is interesting and tutorials are fun. You get to choose when you want to do questions for marks throughout the semester so its chill but the final was worth 40% and cumulative but it was fair.

One of the best prof's i've had during my undergrad. She made lectures engaging and interesting. She was caring, funny and easily accessible for questions or extra help. Always made sure we had reviews before exams and knew what to expect material wise. She also brought her dog in a couple times which was definitely a reason to attend class!

Very accommodating professor I really enjoyed attending her online lectures this semester. I found the content interesting so her lectures flew by. Slides are very organized and she does a good job explaining everything. I hope to take more courses with her in the future. 10/10 would recommend

Suzanna's lectures were clear, and straight to the point. The textbook offered a good source of background knowledge but she mostly touched on everything in her lectures. Lots of weekly participation, but it encouraged me to stay on top of things and understand the content better. I would take another class with Suzanna in a heartbeat!
Overall, this was an interesting class. It requires a lot of reading, but the prof was accommodating and understanding.

My GPA took a huge hit with this course. I had gpa 3.4 and it dropped to 3.2 cause of this course. I only took this class because it count as an upper level credit, but with this prof this class was made way harder then it needed to be. It felt on par with the 320.

I took this as an online class, but I had previously had Suzanna as a TA. She is very clear with her expectations and is approachable. She was also very engaged even with an online course and communicated with students frequently.

Suzanna is seriously the best professor I've had at SFU. I would take it like 100 times over if i could because she's a very strong lecturer and understanding of student issues ex. snow days. She was extremely informative and it was straight forward, no fluffy stuff.

Suzanna is a good instructor, especially given that she is still fairly new to it. My only issue with her is that she crammed a LOT of material into a short amount of time in lectures and consequently talked incredibly fast. It was essentially take notes now, learn later. Tests were all short answer but fair, but they comprised 60% of the grade.

Suzanna is an awesome prof, probably my favourite class that I've taken at SFU. Exams are all written answer questions and the final is cumulative. Gave us oppertunities to get extra credit and the labs were really enjoyable

The class is 100% textbook based and additional journal articles, there are no lectures for her to give online so really she's only marking exams (with the TM). And the TM was the one to email questions to as well. Seems nice, if you find the content interesting you will do well. Mainly midterm and final though.
Suzanna is awesome, she really knows her stuff and communicates very clearly and effectively. Would totally recommend!

Stay clear of this class. The midterm and final are worth a huge chunk of your grades and they are really hard. You have to study very specific details and a lot of important concepts that we had to study was not even on the exams. This was a total disappointment
The exam's for this course are HARSH. Very specific information and they are 100 point exams. Get ready to fail.
